Vote - AcceptText - Fine about κρινεῖν in lin21. I agree with MS that lin12 should be left as it is; των at the start of lin13 may be the end of a word.

Vote - AcceptText - I agree that kappa is unlikely in line 12, but rho's bubble is not evident to me. I'd leave this as is, for the time being, even if the there are clearly 4 more letters worth of ink instead of the edition's unresolved abbreviation. But the future infinitive in line 21 is better, yes.
Submit - Tense change in l. 21.

Commit - In l. 21, the proper form is the future infinitive κρινεῖν after ὀμνύοντας. In l. 12, the alleged abbreviation ἀπακτ( ) must be a form of ἀπαρτίζω. Looks like ἀπαρτίσας (sigma is ok but σα in between cannot be properly confirmed), so no changes there.
Finalized - Ready. I decided to leave the alternative suggestion for the reading at the end of line 17
Vote - AcceptText - Readings are good. A few comments: lin7 ἀχθεὶς is good; lin17-18 I would prefer παρρησιά<ζ>ε|σθαι because after the clear alpha I see traces of only one letter.

Vote - AcceptText - Confirm all on digital image: http://ww2.smb.museum/berlpap/Original/P_25259_R_4.jpg ; Lin7 : in my opinion ἀχθεὶ is absolutely clear, and the final sigma nearly so; so, yes, => ἀχθεὶς ; lin15: ὡ̣μολόγει yes, I even think the omega is clear enough not to need underdog, but fine with it too ; lin15-16: γραμ|ματέως ἄγνοι̣α̣ν̣ ε̣ἶ̣ναι is perfectly reasonable; α̣ν̣ ε̣ is only just barely visible ; lin17-18: I cannot construe a zeta or see the epsilon at all in παρρησιάζ̣ε|σθαι , but I can see παρρησιά<ζ>ε|σθαι clearly enough; I see epsilon at end of the line.
